meanings.definition: A thin, pliable sheet or layer of tissue that covers a surface, lines a cavity, or divides a space or organ.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how the membrane protects the delicate organs.
meanings.sent2: The cell membrane controls what goes in and out of the cell.
meanings.sent3: The membrane was so thin, it felt like holding a delicate piece of paper.
meanings.sent4: Her words formed a protective membrane around his heart.
meanings.sent5: The membrane fluttered in the breeze like a fragile butterfly.

meanings.definition: A thin, flexible film or layer that acts as a boundary or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The plastic wrap acted as a membrane to keep the food fresh.
meanings.sent2: The membrane of the balloon stretched as it was inflated.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the bubble gum was a magical membrane that shielded him from monsters.
meanings.sent4: The fog created a mysterious membrane between the two worlds.
meanings.sent5: The membrane of the soap bubble shimmered in the sunlight.
